reviews.text: There is no parking at this station what so ever. For a main station this is ridiculous, how do you expect people to park up when You want to charge to park when you know there isn’t enough spaces .
Lovely staff, efficient and quick service, never any issues. Facilities clean and near to other travel options, nice area to store bike if need be, there's also car parking facilities.
Disabled ramps, bike stand and shop selling homemade sandwiches, tea, coffee, sweets and newspapers.
The Flying Scotsman at Inverkeithing Train Station.

Reasonable level of facilities; toilets, ticket office, waiting room, onward bus connections and taxi rank. Good frequency of services as Fife commuter services as well as intercity trains call here. Station car park is pay and display. Additional free parking can be found in King Street car park. This is a few minutes walk via a linked footpath which has steps.
